conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
The baffles are designed to redirect the flow of the liquid, and the direction of the arrows indicates the path the liquid takes.
The baffles are labeled A, B, C, and D. These baffles are placed in such a way that they redirect the flow of the liquid.
The arrows indicate the direction of the liquid flow before and after passing through the baffles.
Baffle A: The liquid flows from the top left and is redirected by the baffle. The arrow after the baffle shows the new direction.
Baffle B: The liquid flows from the top center and is redirected by the baffle. The arrow after the baffle shows the new direction.
Baffle C: The liquid flows from the top right and is redirected by the baffle. The arrow after the baffle shows the new direction.
Baffle D: The liquid flows from the top right and is redirected by the baffle. The arrow after the baffle shows the new direction.
After passing through the baffles, the liquid will be directed towards either container E or F.
The arrows after the baffles show that the liquid will flow towards the bottom of the image, and the direction of the arrows indicates the final destination.
The liquid will flow into the container that is aligned with the final direction of the arrows after passing through the baffles.
By observing the arrows, we can see that the liquid will flow into container F.
The liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and will flow into container F.
